sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The Cardano Bitcoin Mining Initiative introduces a first-of-its-kind economic model for the Cardano ecosystem: converting real-world Bitcoin mining revenue into sustainable, verifiable funding for Cardano public goods.



Unlike traditional Catalyst proposals that consume funds, this initiative creates a regenerative revenue engine. A cluster of industrial, hydro-cooled Bitcoin miners, hosted in our already-operational facility, will send all BTC rewards to a public treasury wallet governed by Catalyst or Cardano governance.



**This is innovative because:**



It transforms Catalyst from a grant program into a self-funding economic engine, producing ongoing revenue long after the initial budget.



It bridges Cardano with a real-world industrial asset, giving the ecosystem an RWA-powered yield source with fully auditable inflows.



It leverages Bitcoin’s Proof-of-Work economics to strengthen Cardano, turning external value (BTC block rewards) into internal ecosystem development.



It provides transparency at every stage, with public monitoring of hashrate, uptime, revenue, and treasury balances.



It is immediately scalable. Once the pilot proves ROI, Catalyst can deploy additional miners without needing new research or architecture.



It is designed to generate recurring ecosystem funding, a structural advantage no prior Catalyst proposal has attempted.



This proposal is not theoretical, it's built on top of our already operating, clean energy mining infrastructure, making it both innovative and feasible.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP demonstrates fully operational, revenue-producing Bitcoin miners owned by Cardano, and powered by renewable hydroelectric energy. These first machines serve as the baseline proof-of-concept that the pipeline, from international shipping to installation to real BTC reward flow, functions reliably and transparently.



**The MVP will show:**

- Deployment and activation of Machine #1-#5 in our industrial hydro-cooled facilities.
- Public dashboard showing live hashrate, uptime, and power usage
- Real BTC mining rewards automatically flowing into a publicly verifiable treasury wallet
- Open reporting on $ yield, difficulty adjustments, downtime, and sustainability metrics
- Ability to scale additional machines with identical reliability
- Full transparency via video walkthroughs, installation documentation, and operational videos



**Where it can be accessed:**

- Public BTC treasury wallet (live balance + on-chain explorer)
- Public operational dashboard hosted by Cardania/Ultra Labs
- Monthly Catalyst reporting with operational stats
- Livestreaming mining feeds showing real-time mining data. (Note we have already built this, available at [https://cardania\.io](https://cardania.io))



This MVP demonstrates not just the machine’s operation, but the entire economic pipeline that converts mining output → BTC → Cardano treasury funding.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Success for this initiative is measurable, transparent, and on-chain. 

Key metrics include:



- On-Chain BTC Metrics
- BTC inflows to the public treasury wallet
- Number of successful mining payouts per month
- Total BTC accumulated over the pilot period
- USD-equivalent yield vs. machine cost (ROI progression)
- Operational Metrics
- Machine uptime
- Sustained hashrate
- Milestone verification of Machine #1 → Machine #5 installation
- Monthly operational transparency reports
- Public live dashboard - uptime and accuracy
- Ecosystem Impact Metrics
- Amount of recurring funding generated for Catalyst



Success is defined by establishing a functioning, revenue-generating mining pipeline that is transparent, auditable, and immediately scalable.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The Cardano Bitcoin Mining Initiative deploys a set of industrial-grade, hydro-cooled Bitcoin miners whose block rewards flow directly to a publicly verifiable treasury wallet dedicated to Cardano public goods or Catalyst funding.



Our solution builds on top of real infrastructure we already own and operate: a hydro-powered mining facility in the Pacific Northwest with proven uptime, validated cooling systems, and access to low-cost renewable electricity. Catalyst funding will purchase dedicated machines for Cardano, and we will handle the full lifecycle: procurement, import logistics, installation, electrical integration, cooling, monitoring, maintenance, and public transparency.



By combining physical mining hardware, renewable energy, and transparent treasury accounting, this solution creates a sustainable revenue engine for Cardano. Instead of relying solely on recurring Catalyst budgets, the ecosystem gains a regenerating financial resource powered by real-world infrastructure.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
This project introduces a fundamentally new economic primitive for Cardano: ecosystem-owned infrastructure that converts renewable energy into long-term, on-chain treasury growth.

Key positive impacts include:

1. **Sustainable Funding for Cardano Public Goods**

BTC rewards flow into a public wallet controlled by Catalyst governance. This creates a continuous funding source for open-source development, research, and ecosystem tools.

2. **Strengthening Cardano’s Position in Real\-World Assets \(RWA\)**

This project demonstrates a practical, revenue-generating industrial RWA directly linked to Cardano governance. This showcases the ecosystem’s ability to interact with physical infrastructure, not just financial abstractions.

1. **Increased Treasury Diversification**

Holding BTC creates diversification for Cardano’s public funding mechanisms, reducing reliance on ADA-only treasuries and improving long-term resilience.

1. **Immediate Community Visibility and Transparency**

All hashpower, uptime, and BTC flow will be publicly accessible, demonstrating full operational accountability and setting a high standard for future RWA integrations.

1. **A Scalable Model for Future Catalyst Investments**

Once the pilot proves its ROI, Catalyst can expand the cluster with additional machines or new facilities, replicating the model across regions or energy types, as well as a multiplicity of hosts, ensuring decentralized security.

This initiative demonstrates Cardano’s seriousness about real-world economic integration and long-term sustainability.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
This proposal is grounded in infrastructure, expertise, and operational experience already in place. Our team has a proven track record of designing, building, and running industrial-scale Bitcoin mining operations—making this project highly feasible with minimal risk.



**Our Capabilities**



- Existing hydro-cooled mining facility in the Pacific Northwest with full electrical and cooling infrastructure operational today.
- Engineering expertise in 3-phase electrical systems, modular coolant loop design, ASIC deployment, and operations.
- Operational experience with uptime, maintenance cycles, tuning, firmware optimization, and power efficiency.
- Demonstrated ecosystem commitment, already returning ~$20K USD/month into Cardano via Cardania and multiple partner projects.
- Legally compliant, US based business structure, logistics chain, and vendor relationships already established.
- Facility 2 coming online within ~12 weeks, further expanding capacity.



**Feasibility of the Approach**



- Machines are purchased directly from vetted suppliers with predictable shipping timelines.
- Installation follows a standardized process we already use for dozens of ASICs.
- The cooling system is battle-tested and designed for high-density deployments.
- A public dashboard and BTC treasury wallet provide immediate, continuous verification.
- The milestone structure ensures Catalyst sees operational results as each unit is plugged in.



**Why the Approach is Low\-Risk**



This proposal does not involve experimental technology.

It leverages:



- Proven ASIC hardware
- A fully functional mining facility
- Known operational costs
- Mature monitoring systems
- Experienced operators



The pilot produces measurable output as early as milestone 1, validating feasibility immediately.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Total Request: 200,000 ADA



This budget funds the procurement and activation of five (5) S23-class Bitcoin miners dedicated to generating treasury revenue for the Cardano ecosystem. All funds go directly toward machine acquisition and deployment.



1. **ASIC Procurement — 90% of Budget \(~180,000 ADA\)**



Each S23 miner costs approximately:



~$15,000 USD machine cost



~$1,000 USD cooling loop integration, coolant fittings, mounting, cabling



~$1,000–$2,000 import duties, freight, handling, and customs _\(variance here dependent on month to month international politics/tariffs\)_



Conservative per-unit budget: ~$17,000–$18,000 USD



At current ADA price levels, Catalyst funding enables the purchase of ~5 units, with room for minor logistics variance.



2. **Installation & Commissioning — ~10% of Budget \(~20,000 ADA\)**



This covers:



- Hydro loop connections, dedicated breakers & radiators 
- Firmware configuration and optimization
- Networking, monitoring, and dashboard integration
- Internal automation software
- Initial maintenance and tuning
- Dashboard polishing for public telemetry



**What Catalyst Does Not Pay For**



To maximize ROI, Catalyst funding does not cover:



Facility buildout (already completed / underway)

Unrelated Electrical infrastructure

Unrelated Electrical & Operational Overhead

Hosting Fees_ \(Operator earns 10% of mined BTC \- aligned interests \- we win together\)_



**Total Budget: 200,000 ADA**



This structure ensures the maximum possible conversion of Catalyst funds into real-world assets producing ongoing revenue for Cardano.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
This initiative delivers exceptional value by converting a one-time Catalyst investment into a long-term, recurring revenue source for Cardano. Catalyst funds purchase five S23-class miners; all facility, cooling, electrical engineering, monitoring, and operational infrastructure is already provided by our existing hydro-powered mining operation.

**Real Earnings & Margins**

At current BTC prices, each miner can generate an estimated ~$25-$30 USD/day gross. After electrical costs, the operation runs at 50–60% net margins. With five machines:

**Gross**: ~$3,750–$4,000/month

**Net after electrical**: ~$1,900–$2,400/month

**After 10% operator fee**: ~$1,700–$2,200/month to the Cardano treasury

This equates to an estimated 20–25% annual return on Catalyst’s one-time spend at current BTC difficulty.

**Upside at Higher BTC Prices**

Because operating costs remain relatively stable, rising BTC price can dramatically increase treasury yield:

- $150K BTC: ~$3.5–4.5k/month to treasury
- $250K BTC: ~$6–8k/month
- $500K BTC: ~$12–16k/month
- $1M BTC: ~$24–32k/month

This pilot provides leveraged exposure to BTC’s upside without requiring ADA sales or treasury depletion.

**Capital Efficiency**

**Catalyst does not pay for:**

Unrelated infrastructure, security, or operational labor. Nearly 100% of funds go directly into revenue-generating hardware. All BTC is sent to a public, auditable treasury wallet with a public dashboard showing hashrate, uptime, and inflows.

**Long\-Term Benefit**

The pilot establishes a scalable, repeatable economic model for Cardano, an industrial real-world asset producing continuous funding for public goods. As soon as Machine #1 comes online (Milestone 1), BTC revenue begins flowing.

A single 200k ADA investment seeds a permanent, transparent, renewable revenue engine for the Cardano ecosystem.
